fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32126].
  {panel}

Our users are increasingly avoiding Confluence as a knowledge base, since dropbox / skydrive offer much better usability in their work scenarios. Our people travel much and want to have their documents offline on their own devices with automatic sync á la dropbox.

We do not want to introduce owncloud.org or similar services as a parallel solution. Also 3rd party webdav sync clients do not offer the level of usability required by our users.

When can we expect something similar for Confluence?
I assume that syncing the page content and page meta content is a bigger issue. However, this is not really necessary in a first step. Already the syncing of attachments in a folder(page) and sub folder (sub pages) would be tremendously helpful.

It would be great, if this can find its way into the product roadmap - I assume that we are not the only one looking for alternatives.

Thanks
fields.summary: File Sync to Desktop and Mobile
Default Skype action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32115].
  {panel}

Long time ago, I left a comment in 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/users/removepagenotification.action?pageId=251006017

Since I left a comment there, I get notifications because I'm added as a watcher by adding a comment automatically.

Whenever, I try to use the link of "Stop Watching Page" from email, 
it gave me "Page Not Found". 
I thought Atlassian had a problem with broken link.

Today, I figured out "True meaning" of this "Page Not Found".
As you can see in attached screen capture here, 
it noticed that there is a possibility that the page exists but I don't have permission to view it.

Then I realized that I won't be able to stop watching without logging it.

So, what I am trying to suggest here is...
1. If the Page exists, don't display it as Page Not Found, especially when user has not logged in.
2. Or, at least, when accessing"removepagenotification.action" page without logged in session, it should redirect to Login page. Because no one will be able to manage without logging in.
3. Simply, redirect to login page where user credential is mandatory.
4. Or, you could redirect to login page if you see "src=email" parameter in URL, which means the user is registered user of the system because the user received an email regarding this page.

Atlassian people keep their login always, so you might not see this often.
However, as a external customer, we don't keep login for CAC.
"Page Not Found" message was improper in this case.

Please, improve this behavior.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Improve Not logged in status when accessing remove page notification page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32108].
  {panel}

Currently, Administrators can receive notification via email only when a user signs up to Confluence. This user will be created in Confluence Internal Directory.
However, if Confluence is using Delegated External Directory while enabling 'Copy User on Login' option, when an LDAP user logs in to the system, Administrators doesn't get any email notification.

It would be very helpful if Confluence Administrators is notified via email with the same information as when a user signs up to Confluence such as the following:
{panel}
|    A new user joined Confluence: 
|
|    Username:Name
|    Email: name.lastname@...
|    Your Confluence site now has N users, with a license limit of 2,000. 
{panel}

This would be a great improvement for Confluence Administrators to track the number of licensed user in the system and know the latest user creation to the system.
fields.summary: Notify Administrators by Email When an Account is Created from Delegated External Directory

fields.description:
If a REST resource in a confluence plugin returns a full HTML document using the text/html content type, everything surrounding the body gets removed.

This is due to a too generic decorator in the confluence-editor plugin called "vanilla":

{noformat}
    <decorator name="vanilla" page="vanilla.vmd" key="vanilla">
        <description>Decorator to allow HTML served by REST resources to be undecorated</description>
        <pattern>/rest*</pattern>
    </decorator>
{noformat}

It matches any REST resource in the system but I would argue that REST resources should never be decorated using the SiteMeshFilter and rather use some other approach to achieve the same effect.
fields.summary: Body gets extracted from HTML when returned from a REST resource

fields.description:
I don't know the full story here but there have been numerous reports on EAC now of cases where clicking on a search result gives a 'Not permitted' response. Further investigation by an admin will show that in these cases a parent or grandparent has viewing restrictions applied.

It would appear that inherited permissions are not indexing properly.

In most cases I can confirm that the affected content had also been moved to be beneath the restricted parent (or grandparent). I'm not sure if this is always the case for this issue but it could be. I would certainly start trying to reproduce the problem by moving unrestricted content to beneath a restricted grand-parent and see if the refactoring code updates the permissions in the index.

This is raised as critical because it can result in a leak of the titles of restricted content.
fields.summary: Content with inherited restrictions still appears in search results

fields.description:
There are two types of confluence macro plugin modules since Confluence 4.0:
* xhtml-macro modules define macros that can be embedded straight into the xhtml through the RTE.
* macro modules define modules that can be used within a wiki markup block.

Most actual macros in Confluence have both forms.  However, some macros, deliberately or accidentally, such as the Documentation Link macro, only exist in wiki markup.

Such macros still appear in the macro browser _even though they cannot be inserted this way._

I assume this has been broken since 4.0 but I have only tested 5.0 so far.
fields.summary: Macros that cannot be inserted through the RTE still appear in the Macro Browser

fields.description:
I'v registered at Windows destop/workstation side the protocol "tns://" and "ssh://" for autologin functionality from the web URL, and we (Asseco Poland) intended to store complex map of links to terminals and databases for many systems and maintenance environments resources in form of URL's like this:
1) ssh://user:pass@host:port/path
2) tns://user:pass/sid or tns://sid$user:pass
and in near future:
3) ftp://user:pass@host:port/path
4) sftp://user:pass@host:port/path
5) jdbc://user:pass@host:port/database
6) autologinhttp://user:pass@host:port/path

Case 1) works, but in 2) the Confluence somehow interprets "tns://" protocol differently by eating ':', '/', '$' characters, creating something like this "tns://userpass". Why it interprets my URL's!?!
Could I switch something within Confluence to not interpret it any longer, maybe register "tns://" at the server (Confluence) side, or in the Confluence config files?
fields.summary: Eaten chars in link URL

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32075].
  {panel}

As a user,
I want alphabet markers for bullet lists,
So that I can identify list items, but not necessarily impose order.

AC:
- A. In Editor menu bar, next to the numbered bullet list, there should be another button for alphabet bullet list.
- B. Assign hotkey, e.g., Ctrl+Shift+A ('A' for alphabet).
- C. Assign a macro char (just like '*' is used for normal list, and '#' used for numbered list).
- D. The alphabet list operates just like the numbered list, except shows uppercase alphabet chars (or provide option to choose capitalization, for the whole list).  Once the list passes 'Z', start with 'AA', 'AB', etc.
fields.summary: Editor - Provide alphabet bullet list

fields.summary: Calendar error

fields.description: According bug [conf-28721|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28721] this issue is solved in version 5.3.1. We are now testing an upgrade to 5.3.4 and this bug seems not be be resolved.
fields.summary: renderConfluenceMacro on include macro does not render sections of a page

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Attach Calendar.xls to a Confluence page
# Insert > Other Macros > Office Excel > Specify the file name as Calendar.xls > Specify the worksheet name as ThisWeek > Click Preview or insert the macro to the page
# The result is *Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "3-2$C"*:
!excel.jpg!

NOTE: The same issue is not reproducible in Confluence 3.4.9
fields.summary: viewxls macro failed to render certain worksheet in an excel file

fields.description:
I can't see any timeout configuration for app-links but this perhaps could be part of the solution.

On a recent EAC outage we see a lot of heap being used by responses from JIRA, and we also see responses taking an increasing length of time to come back.

!jdog.png!

This graph is interesting. The 9:50am spike in throughput seems to lead to a ramp up in GC activity. Perhaps related to JIRA responses being large or our processing of them inefficient in object creation (see CONF-32067). Response times look reasonable at this point.

Then around 10:02am response times start to really spike and throughput drops. It looks like this results in an outage to EAC users at this point. These long lived calls may also be contributing to the GC pain as objects are hanging around too long and surviving too many GC sweeps.

I think we need a way to both limit how many concurrent JIRA connections we allow and to timeout them out where necessary.

Doing this in conjunction with the other 'coathanger' integrations, such as the JIRA issues header would be really nice. At the moment trying to throttle and manage the connections from Confluence to JIRA is very difficult.
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro appears to starve the http request pool when external calls are taking a long time

fields.description:
While investigating the latest EAC outage I found that there were too many large objects consuming old gen memory.

One of the offenders is the JiraChannelResponseHandler. See screenshot -

!jira.png!

So 840 objects consuming an average of 70Kb each is not reasonable (for EAC anyway, especially in conjunction with some of our other heavy cache using plugins).

Regardless of any actual bug fix you might consider making could you please also get in touch with me and advise on what kind of tuning of caches etc I should be performing on EAC to avoid this much memory being consumed again.
fields.summary: Too many JiraChannelResponseHandler objects cached on Confluence taking too much memory

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32066].
  {panel}

Confluence doesn't save user action on its page tree and open only the tree where the page reside once it accessed. 

*How to replicate :*

# Access a space with a documentation theme
# Open multiple page trees on the side bar
# Access one of the page
# Confluence will close the other opened page tree and will *only* open the tree where the accessed page reside

Sometime, user might open multple page to help them navigate through Confluence space multiple pages easily. However, due to this behavior such user may need to open those trees multiple times.
fields.summary: Confluence should Save User Action On its Page Tree
Provide Old Dropdown Menu for Attachment Macros

fields.description:
h2. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a parent page namend "Page A"
# Create a parent page namend "Page B"
# Access "Page List" from Space Administator menu
# Enable [fiddler|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Capturing+HTTP+traffic+using+Wireshark+or+Fiddler] to capture HTTP request
# Reorder Page B to become the children of Page A
# Review the HTTP request used by Confluence through fiddler
# Reorder Page A to become the children of Page B
# Review the HTTP request used by Confluence through fiddler
# Select those two HTTP request
# Right click and choose re-issue request

h2. Expected Results:

Confluence should block the HTTP request which will result to Page A and B to become a parent page of each other in the database state. Trying to execute this request in browser URL at the same time will cause Confluence to lock down and reject the other request to ensure such issue to occurred.

h2. Actual Results:

We could successfully made two pages become parent page of each other through fiddler. This confirm, there is a possiblity of such issue to occurr if two users fire up the same request.

This inconsistency in the database will cause Confluence to load the page indefinitely when user try to access one of the page. There are no helpful stack trace to troubleshoot this issue
fields.summary: Pages Parenting each Other Will Cause Confluence to be Unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Install Confluence 5.4 clustered.
# Go to _Cog Icon > Confluence Admin > User Macros_
# After saving a default macro, you get the following stack-trace:
{code}
013-12-19 15:57:23,966 WARN [scheduler_Worker-10] [plugins.macrousage.extractor.MacroExtractor] processXhtml Exception extracting macro usages on 90394406 
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Resource is not serializable: Key=https://CONFLUENCE_WEB/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:gadget-search/gadgets/gadget-search.xml.all_ALL, Value=<messagebundle>
<msg name="gadget.common.invalid.period">Invalid period ''{0}'' specified</msg>
{code} 

You may also find the error message varies slightly. Other symptoms include the Macro Browser refusing to open after being clicked.

h3. Workaround:
To resolve this, you must configure to be a local cache. Edit {{confluence-home/config/confluence-coherence-cache-config-clustered.xml}}, and place the following just before the closing {{</caching-scheme-mapping>}} tag:

{code}
<cache-mapping>
    <cache-name>com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.cache.messageBundles</cache-name>
    <scheme-name>local:default</scheme-name>
</cache-mapping>
{code}

Save the file, and restart that node. You will need to make this change to each node's configuration file for the workaround to be 100% effective.
fields.summary: User Macro in cluster environment is broken due cache messageBundles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32057].
  {panel}

Please add an option to upload an audio file into the user profile with the (preferred/correct) spelling of the user name. Please add a "play" button to spell out the name.

Rational:
When working with multi-national, multi-language teams, there are many cases where the user name can not be described for the whole team to use.

In many cases, the English spelling is not enough to know how to spell the user name.

Entering the name in local language is not useful. e.g., Non Chinese speakers can not use the Chinese symbols to know how to pronounce the name.

Extra bonus: It will be nice if there will  be a dictionary of spelled names that will arrive pre-bundled, and allow the users to choose from those names (best on their first name).
fields.summary: Allow loading of audio file - name pronounciation in user profile

fields.description:
1. create a blog post with title containing special characters (e.g.: "svn c[omm]i[t]")
2. copy the created page's url to the clipboard (e.g.: https://servername//display/spacename/2013/12/19/svn+c%5Bomm%5Di%5Bt%5D)
3. in another page, in a rich text editor (comment, edit, etc.) Paste in the link from the clipboard
4. notice the link doesn't get resolved to the proper page title, but both the title and the link gets truncated (href: "https://servername/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=BIS&title=omm", link text: "omm")

The desired behavior would be to have the pasted link turn into the proper link href (https://servername//display/spacename/2013/12/19/svn+c%5Bomm%5Di%5Bt%5D) and text (svn c[omm]i[t])

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32038].
  {panel}

When attempting to update the docs for space colour scheme I noticed a number of items don't seem to be in use anymore (not that I could tell in the space with either the default theme or doc theme):

* Page menu selected background 
* Space name text
* Border and dividers
* Tab navigation background
* Tab navigation text
* Tab navigation background highlight
* Tab navigation text highlight
 
Could we remove these, or if they are still in use (but only in specific circumstances) separate them out from the basic header colour scheme options?  Its very confusing.
fields.summary: Update colour scheme UI to remove redundant items

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32036].
  {panel}

h2. Problem
* Our Tools menu is overloaded with a lot of things, a lot of people have banner blindness to things there
* Sharing is more than sending an email, it's about things like sharing a link to the page or even one day sharing a private URL to a page

h2. Suggestion
# Kill the Tools > Link to this page dialog
# Update the Share button to include a section "Copy link to page..."
When you click on that, it would "accordion up" effect and give you a text box to copy the tiny URL link for the page

Sample mockup:
!http://cl.ly/image/412k1K353x1O/Image%202013.12.19%2010%3A59%3A38%20am.png!
fields.summary: Remove Tools > "Link to this page" feature, move that functionality to the "Share Page" dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32033].
  {panel}

Currently, an applcation link can only have one instance to each server it link to.

However, when importing spaces from external Confluence instance pointing to external Jira instance that are also imported, all the application links will point to the old instance, breaking every macro using that link.

The fix suggested mention editing and saving the affected macro, but when you have hundred of macro, this is not a viable option.

The alternative is to go into the database and rename every occurrence of the old link and replace ti with the new name.

By allowing Application Links aliases, one could create an alias using the old link name and all macro would still work.


This also apply to Jira macho, which utilize the Application Link name to references which Jira instance to use. Should the application link be renamed or imported with a different name, they will all break.

Editing the macro will fix it, but in the case of a voluminous space, this can be impossible unless manually converted inside the database while Confluence is offline.
fields.summary: Application link Alias

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32032].
  {panel}

Lacking ways to filter the restricted pages you can view from space admin in Confluence (the list includes docs in the trash for example), it would be nice / make more sense if 

- The restricted pages list included pages in the trash. If you click such pages, you get a page stating it's in the trash, but then you can't remove the restriction. I would do so just so I could get it off my report. We use restrictions to hide pages before release.
- You could filter the list (e.g. don't include pages in trash, or person, or type of restriction)
- You could sort the list
fields.summary: Space Admin > Restricted Pages report improvements e.g. don't show pages in trash
Allow Confluence to Print/Export All Versions of a Page

fields.description:
Just noticed this today: When editing an Advanced link that points to an anchor in another space, the link breaks. The way this happens is that the SPACEKEY in the advanced link disappears upon editing.

How to reproduce:
# Create a new space called FRUITS.
# Create a new page in FRUITS called Apples.
# Write a heading "Apples are great" and Save the page.
# Create another space called VEGGIES
# Create a new page in VEGGIES called Broccoli.
# Insert a new Link in Broccoli, select the Advanced tab
# In the Link field, type "FRUITS:Apples#Apples are great" and click Save.
# Now edit the link again. "FRUITS:" has disappeared from the link.
# Save the link. You can now see it is broken.

If you save the page after step 7, the link works. So the link specifically breaks upon re-editing it. For some reason Confluence drops the SPACEKEY upon editing the link.
fields.summary: Advanced links that point to anchors in other spaces break upon editing

fields.description:
Versions:
* Confluence 5.3.4, also affects 5.4.1
* Firefox 26.0 on Ubuntu 12.04

To reproduce:
* Open [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Tables#WorkingwithTables-Shortcutkeys].
* Press the mouse button to the left of the letter A in the word “Action” in the heading of the table.
* Drag over the whole word.
* Release. (The whole drag operation needs to be done quickly for the bug to reproduce.)

Expected: The word “Action” is selected. The table is not sorted.
Observed: Selection does not happen. The table is sorted.

* Click the right mouse button over any heading cell.

Expected: The browser context menu opens.
Observed: The browser context menu opens. The table is sorted.

* Press the middle button and release it over a heading cell. (E.g. in an autoscrolling gesture.)

Expected: The table is not sorted.
Observed: The table is sorted.


The only way I expect to sort the table is by clicking a heading cell with the primary button, without moving my mouse. If I move the mouse, it’s a text selection operation. If I click any other button, it’s browser-specific page manipulation.
fields.summary: Table sorting triggers on any button release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31993].
  {panel}

Since the latest OnDemand release, pulling a filter from JIRA in Confluence isn't working as expected. When used, the following message is returned:
{quote}
There are problems with the current configuration for this gadget. The errors below may have been caused by the deletion of entities required by the gadget or by changes to your permissions.
* *Invalid project or filter*
{quote}

This can also manifest as the following error message:
{quote}The filter for this gadget did not return any issues{quote}
Even though the filter in question does return issues.

This also prevents the creation of any gadget that uses JIRA filters, aside from the JIRA Issues macro (which uses a different communication mechanism not affected by this problem).

Screenshots are attached.

h3. Download customers also affected

Confluence 5.3.4, 5.4 and greater are also affected by this issue, when using Trusted Apps for applinks between Confluence and JIRA.

h3. Workarounds

The known workarounds for this issue are:
* manually replace the gadget filter with a [JIRA Issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro]. When configuring the JIRA Issues macro (just called 'JIRA' in the macro browser), you can have it use a filter by entering {{filter=FILTERID}} into the search box.
* [Reconfigure the applink authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Configuring+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link] between affected applications to use OAuth instead of Trusted Apps.
* For Confluence behind firewall v5.4, 5.4.1 (*Do not install on different versions of confluence*), install the open social plugin from [Steve's comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31993?focusedCommentId=549703&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-549703]. Flush all caches if you have any issue to access the gadgets after the plugin installation.
fields.summary: Filter results gadget (or anything that uses a filter in JIRA) isn't working.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31992].
  {panel}

When a user try to upgrade Confluence using installer version, Confluence will remove directories in the installation directories and create a new set of directories.

However, directories such as {{temp}}, {{logs}} and {{work}} are not touched during the upgrade process. This mean those three directories might have a different permission configuration.

This leads to Confluence have the possibility for not being able to access those directories which cause issues.

It would be great if we could warn our customer by putting the above information on our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence].
fields.summary: Upgrading Confluence Using Installer Version Leads to Permission Issue

fields.description:
I have been editing a document for a number of times without any problems.
I have two gliffy images otherwise pretty standard. I have also been getting some mail from confluence complaining about some locks. I could not figure out how to release those locks, but af ter a few days I got a mail saying the locks had been forcibly released.

Anyway now I can't edit this document. When I try it takes 30 - 45 seconds then I get this error:
--------------------------
Proxy Error

The proxy server received an invalid response from an upstream server.
The proxy server could not handle the request GET /pages/editpage.action.

Reason: Error reading from remote server

Apache/2.2.15 (CentOS) Server at confluence.medical-insight.com Port 443
----------------------------

I can edit all other documents and other people can also edit the problematic one - even on my machine. 
I tried to delete cookies for confluence, but that did not help.

Is there a way to reset some stuff on the server, so it does not assume anything about that particular document in relation to me, or how can we go about fixing this?

Regards Martin Lütken
fields.summary: Proxy error on editing specific document with specific user
